Data Structures

Data structures module for pyxalign.

This module provides core data structures that the user will interface with.

class pyxalign.data_structures.Projections(*, projections: ndarray, angles: ndarray, options: ProjectionOptions, scan_numbers: ndarray | None = None, probe_positions: list[ndarray] | None = None, center_of_rotation: ndarray | None = None, masks: ndarray | None = None, probe: ndarray | None = None, skip_pre_processing: bool = False, add_center_offset_to_positions: bool = True, shift_manager: ShiftManager | None = None, transform_tracker: TransformTracker | None = None, pin_arrays: bool = False, file_paths: list[str] | None = None)[source]

plot_projections(process_function: callable = <function Projections.<lambda>>)[source]
plot_shift(shift_type: ShiftManagerMemberType, title: str | None = None, plot_kwargs: dict = {})[source]

Plot different kinds of shifts stored in the ShiftManager object.

Parameters:

  • shift_type (ShiftManagerMemberType) – The type of shift to plot. Can be entered as the

  • "applied_shift_total" (strings)

  • "applied_shift_seperate"

  • "staged_shift". (or)

  • title (str) – If included, title will override the default titling.

plot_shift_summary(plot_kwargs: dict = {})[source]

Show plots summarizing all of the applied shifts and the staged shift

plot_shifted_projections(shift: ~numpy.ndarray, process_function: callable = <function Projections.<lambda>>)[source]

Plot the shifted projections using the shift that was passed in.
